prompt.p: In a 70 kg adult human being, about 60% is total body water, made up of intracellular and extracellular fluids. The extracellular fluids are divided into interstitial fluid and blood plasma.
Which anion and which cation are the major constituents of intracellular fluid?

modalFeedback.p:
Option C (Sodium and phosphate) is Correct. The major intracellular ions are sodium (Na + ) and large anions such as protein and phosphate.
Option A (Potassium and chloride) is Incorrect. Potassium is mainly extracellular.
Option B (Potassium and sodium) is Incorrect. Potassium is mainly extracellular.
Option D (Phosphate and potassium) is Incorrect. Potassium is mainly extracellular.
Option E (Sodium and chloride) is Incorrect. Chloride is mainly extracellular.
